abstract: Three Google employees were given six-month suspended sentences but cleared of defamation charges.
snippet: Three Google employees were given six-month suspended sentences but cleared of defamation charges.
lead_paragraph: ROME — An Italian judge convicted three Google employees in February of violating privacy laws because the Internet company had sought to profit from a video of an autistic boy being bullied by classmates, according to a judicial reasoning in the case released on Monday.

headline.main: Italian Judge Cites Profit as Justifying a Google Conviction
headline.print_headline: Italian Judge Cites Profit as Justifying a Google Conviction

abstract: Monday’s reading list includes new tools for Twitter and other Web sites and a Google acquisition of a visual search company.
snippet: Monday’s reading list includes new tools for Twitter and other Web sites and a Google acquisition of a visual search company.
lead_paragraph: Considering how distracted the New York Times tech reporters and editors were today, they did a fair amount of Web searching for other worthwhile news. Monday’s reading list includes:

headline.main: What We’re Reading: Technology to Help Journalism

abstract: The Dow Jones industrial average inched above 11,000 on Monday — and, for the first time since the dark days of 2008, actually managed to stay there.
snippet: The Dow Jones industrial average inched above 11,000 on Monday — and, for the first time since the dark days of 2008, actually managed to stay there.
lead_paragraph: A few little points was all it took.

abstract: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Apple is tightening its already firm grip on what software can run on the iPhone and its other mobile devices, as shown by its recent changes to the rules that outside programmers must follow, The New York Times’s Jenna Wortham reported.

headline.main: Apple Places New Limits on App Developers

abstract: As Google continues its shopping spree, the search giant has picked up Plink, the maker of an android application that can recognize and identify artwork, The Guardian reported.
snippet: As Google continues its shopping spree, the search giant has picked up Plink, the maker of an android application that can recognize and identify artwork, The Guardian reported.
lead_paragraph: As Google continues its shopping spree, the search giant has picked up Plink, the maker of an Android application that can recognize and identify artwork, The Guardian reported.
